Abu-Assi E, García-Acuña JM, Peña-Gil C, González-Juanatey JR. Validation of the GRACE risk score for predicting death within 6 months of follow-up in a contemporary cohort of patients with acute coronary syndrome. Rev Esp Cardiol. 2010;63(6):640–648. doi:10.1016/s1885-5857(10)70138-9.
Eagle KA, Lim MJ, Dabbous OH, et al. A validated prediction model for all forms of acute coronary syndrome: estimating the risk of 6-month postdischarge death in an international registry. JAMA. 2004;291(22):2727–2733. doi:10.1001/jama.291.22.2727.
Fox KA, Dabbous OH, Goldberg RJ, et al. Prediction of risk of death and myocardial infarction in the six months after presentation with acute coronary syndrome: prospective multinational observational study (GRACE). BMJ. 2006;333(7578):1091. doi:10.1136/bmj.38985.646481.55.

details.purpose: Att uppskatta 6-månadersmortalitet hos nyligen mottagna patienter med akut koronart syndrom.
details.use:
Använd för att uppskatta 6-månadersmortalitet hos nyligen mottagna patienter med akut koronart syndrom. Instrumentet baseras på följande åtta faktorer:
Ålder Hjärtfrekvens Systoliskt blodtryck Kreatininvärde, angivet i mg/dl Hjärtstopp vid ankomst till sjukhus Patologiska ST-förändringar på EKG Förhöjda/avvikande hjärtmarkörer Killip-klassificering (Klass I - ingen hjärtsvikt, klass II - rassel och/eller halsvenstas, klass III - lungödem, klass IV - kardiogen chock)
Resultatet uppgår till maximalt 372p - för detaljerad beskrivning av poängsystemet vänligen se (1). Resultatet tolkas enligt:
Non-STEMI inlagd på sjukhus: 1-108p - låg risk (<1% risk att avlida på sjukhuset) 109-140p - mellanrisk (1-3% risk att avlida på sjukhuset) 141-372p - hög risk (>3% risk att avlida på sjukhuset)
För detaljerad beskrivning av denna tolkning, vänligen se (2).
details.misuse: Instrumentet är ej avsett för att identifiera patienter med akut koronart syndrom och ska endast användas i samråd med utförlig klinisk utredning.

details.purpose: To record the results for each component parameter, the total sum and grade for the GRACE score recorded at or after discharge.
details.use: Use to record the results for each component parameter, the total sum and grade for the GRACE score recorded at or after discharge.
details.misuse:
Not to be used to record details about the initial GRACE score recorded during admission - use the OBSERVATION.grace_admission for this purpose.
Not to be used to record details about the GRACE 2.0 score.

items.items: The original 9 variable version of an assessment tool used to risk stratify patients diagnosed with Acute Coronary Syndrome - specifically to estimate their risk of death on discharge and up to 6 months after the ACS event.
GRACE is an acronym for Global Registry of Acute Coronary Events.
Default, unspecified point in time event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Category of heart rate at initial hospital presentation.
Category of systolic blood pressure at initial hospital presentation.
Category of serum creatinine measurement at initial hospital presentation.
ST segment depression at initial hospital presentation.
Raised cardiac enzymes or markers during hospitalisation.
Sum of points assigned for each of the component parameters.
No ST segment depression observed on ECG.
ST segment depression observed on ECG.
Cardiac enzymes or markers are in the normal range.
Cardiac enzymes or markers are raised.
Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms.
For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR.
Known history of congestive heart failure?
Known history of acute myocardial infarction?

*The original 9 variable version of an assessment tool used to risk stratify patients diagnosed with Acute Coronary Syndrome - specifically to estimate their risk of death on discharge and up to 6 months after the ACS event. (en)
*GRACE is an acronym for Global Registry of Acute Coronary Events. (en)
*Default, unspecified point in time event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time. (en)
*Category of heart rate at initial hospital presentation. (en)
*Category of systolic blood pressure at initial hospital presentation. (en)
*Category of serum creatinine measurement at initial hospital presentation. (en)
*ST segment depression at initial hospital presentation. (en)
*Raised cardiac enzymes or markers during hospitalisation. (en)
*Sum of points assigned for each of the component parameters. (en)
*Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models/formalisms. (en)
*For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR. (en)
